Your information is SSL encrypted and safely stored. 24/7 Support Our dedicated team of customer support experts are always available to assist you with every need or request, anywhere you are in your native language. CDFs Crypto Currency Binary Trade with Confidence Access Our Complete Set of Features and Personalise Your Trading Life

thought: The extracted text shows several red flags: promises of easy and quick money, unusually high leverage, and testimonials that seem overly positive. These could be indicative of scam characteristics. The mention of regulation by IFSC is something that can be verified, as well as the existence of the company.

thought: The WHOIS information shows that the domain is registered and provides a privacy service for the registrant's contact information. This is not unusual, but it can be a sign that the website owner wants to remain anonymous, which can be a red flag for scam websites.

"}, {'url': 'https://consumer.ftc.gov/consumer-alerts/2021/05/spotting-cryptocurrency-investment-scams', 'content': "In fact, the FTC's new data spotlight shows that, since October 2020, nearly 7,000 people reported losses to bogus cryptocurrency investments, adding up to more than $80 million. People ages 20-49 were more than five times more likely than other age groups to report losing money on those scams. But here's an even more striking point: people ..."}, {'url': 'https://financialcommission.org/2023/03/24/scam-alert-360cryptotraders-added-to-warning-list/', 'content': 'March 24, 2023. Concerned traders have notified the Financial Commission regarding the company 360CryptoTraders and its associated website.. Upon reviewing the submitted information from potential customers of this broker, the Financial Commission has determined that the indicated company and associated website may be used to scam and defraud traders and investors.'}, {'url': 'https://www.forbes.com/advisor/investing/cryptocurrency/top-crypto-scams/', 'content': 'Since many have become accustomed to upgrades in the digital age, scammers can easily trick crypto holders into giving up their private keys as part of an “upgrade.”
Upgrade scammers can piggyback on legitimate migrations, such as the recent Ethereum merge, which had both the Ethereum Foundation and Robinhood concerned enough to issue a warning that users be on “high alert” for upgrade scams.
 “Given the speed at which new coins are created and marketed to investors on the internet without regulation, some investors looking to earn a quick profit are drawn in by reports of triple-digit percentage gains in a digital asset over a short period of time and want to jump on the bandwagon,” he says.
 “As an instrument, crypto scams are particularly appealing to nefarious agents who enjoy cryptocurrency’s swift conversion to fiat money, ready-to-use third-party transaction applications and rich obfuscation techniques,” says Chengqi “John” Guo, professor of computing information systems and business analytics at James Madison University.
Types of Crypto Scams
Crypto scams can take many forms. You can report crypto scams to the following places:
You can also file a complaint to the crypto exchange you used to send the money.
 This latter type of scam could involve breaking into a person’s crypto wallet or getting an investor to send a digital asset as a form of payment for a fraudulent transaction, says Shane Cummings, wealth advisor and director of technology and cybersecurity for Halbert Hargrove.
'}, {'url': 'https://scamwatcher.org/360cryptotraders-review/', 'content': '360CryptoTraders Review: our Conclusion! 360CryptoTraders is an unregulated platform to avoid. This is a strong indication that the website could indeed be a scam. I now know the final answer. The URL https://360cryptotraders.com/ is a scam website.
